column4: US STOCKS-Amazon and Microsoft nudge S&P 500 closer to record high
column5: * Tesla jumps after Musk says he wants to take company private

column4: US STOCKS-Amazon and Alphabet push S&P 500 closer to record high
column5: Aug 7 The S&P 500 inched toward a record high on Tuesday  lifted by Amazon  Alphabet and Microsoft  and by a strong second-quarter earnings season that fueled optimism about the strength in the U.S. economy.

column4: India's Ola to launch in Britain as Uber rivalry heats up
column5: NEW DELHI Indian ride-hailing firm Ola said on Tuesday it plans to launch services in Britain this year  months after expanding operations in Australia  intensifying its rivalry with U.S. peer Uber Technologies Inc [UBER.UL].

column4: UPDATE 1-India's Ola to launch in Britain as Uber rivalry heats up
column5: NEW DELHI  Aug 7 Indian ride-hailing firm Ola said on Tuesday it plans to launch services in Britain this year  months after expanding operations in Australia  intensifying its rivalry with U.S. peer Uber Technologies Inc .

column4: Musk plan to privatize Tesla pushes $2.3 billion of debt above conversion price
column5: NEW YORK Elon Musk's suggestion on Tuesday that he would like to take  Tesla Inc private may provide something the electric car maker needs: a little debt relief.

column4: Musk plan to privatize Tesla pushes $2.3 bln of debt above conversion price
column5: NEW YORK  Aug 7 Elon Musk's suggestion on Tuesday that he would like to take  Tesla Inc private may provide something the electric car maker needs: a little debt relief.

column4: Breakingviews - Tesla buyout would need to go short on leverage
column5: NEW YORK (Reuters Breakingviews) - Elon Musk has set up a new diversion for the electric-car maker he runs. On Tuesday he announced on Twitter he is “considering taking Tesla private at $420. Funding secured.” That’s not as big a long shot as it might sound. But a buyout would have to be short on leverage.

column4: Tesla call options soar on Musk tweet  short-sellers hit
column5: NEW YORK Some nimble traders in Tesla Inc's options made massive paper profits on Tuesday  while short-sellers were hit with about $1.3 billion in paper losses after Tesla Chief Executive Elon Musk tweeted he was considering taking the company private at $420 a share.

column4: Tesla buyout would add to year of pain for short-sellers
column5: NEW YORK It would be the ultimate black eye for short sellers.

column4: UPDATE 3-Tesla call options soar on Musk tweet  short-sellers hit
column5: NEW YORK  Aug 7 Some nimble traders in Tesla Inc's options made massive paper profits on Tuesday  while short-sellers were hit with about $1.3 billion in paper losses after Tesla Chief Executive Elon Musk tweeted he was considering taking the company private at $420 a share.

column4: Tesla statement on potential deal to go private
column5: The following blog post was published on Tuesday by Tesla Inc Chief Executive Elon Musk following his earlier comments on Twitter about taking the company private. The link to the full blog is: https://www.tesla.com/blog/taking-tesla-private?redirect=no
